actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Social Security Act to ensure that reasonable efforts are taken to inform applicants for benefits under such Act of the effect of failure to meet the sixty-day time limit for commencement of actions for court review of unfavorable final decisions or determinations pursuant to such applications.
short_title: Social Security Due Process Amendments of 1986
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Social Security Due Process Amendments of 1986 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to require that an application for benefits include a statement notifying applicants of: (1) the 60-day period (or any longer period authorized by the Secretary of Health and Human Services) for commencing court review of a final decision or determination of the Secretary rendered after a hearing; and (2) the consequences of failing to commence an action within such period.

titles.title: Social Security Due Process Amendments of 1986

A bill to amend the Social Security Act to ensure that reasonable efforts are taken to inform applicants for benefits under such Act of the effect of failure to meet the sixty-day time limit for commencement of actions for court review of unfavorable final decisions or determinations pursuant to such applications.
